else.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: besides or in addition to someone or something
else.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: There’s something else I’d like to talk about as well.
I’d like you to come, and anyone else who’s free.
He was awake now, as was everyone else.
Who else was at the party?
Above all else (=more than any other things) she was seeking love.
else.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: used to talk about a different person, thing, place etc
else.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: I’d like to live anywhere else but here.
If I can’t trust you, who else can I trust?
else.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: used after a question word to say that the thing, person, or place you have mentioned is the only one possible
else.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: ‘What are you doing?’ ‘Waiting for you, what else?’
else.translation[0].note_box[0].items[0]: The possessive form of someone/anyone else is someone/anyone else’s
Nobody else’s cooking is as good as yours
